detaileddescription.para: Construct a CCSD wave function from its converged T1- and T2-amplitudes.

memberdef.argsstring: (const SquareMatrix< Scalar > &f, const SquareRankFourTensor< Scalar > &V_A, const T1Amplitudes< Scalar > &t1, const T2Amplitudes< Scalar > &t2)
memberdef.name: calculateCorrelationEnergy

parameterdescription.para: the antisymmetrized two-electron integrals (in physicist's notation)

memberdef.argsstring: (const size_t i, const size_t a, const SquareMatrix< Scalar > &f, const SquareRankFourTensor< Scalar > &V_A, const T1Amplitudes< Scalar > &t1, const T2Amplitudes< Scalar > &t2, const ImplicitMatrixSlice< Scalar > &F1, const ImplicitMatrixSlice< Scalar > &F2, const ImplicitMatrixSlice< Scalar > &F3)
memberdef.name: calculateT1AmplitudeEquation

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the value for one of the CCSD T1-amplitude equations, evaluated at the given T1- and T2-amplitudes (and itermediates). f_i^a = <Phi_i^a| H |Phi_0> with H the similarity-transformed normal-ordered Hamiltonian

parameterdescription.para: the (occupied) subscript for the amplitude equation
the (virtual) superscript for the amplitude equation
the antisymmetrized two-electron integrals (in physicist's notation)

simplesect.para: the value for one of the CCSD T1-amplitude equations

memberdef.argsstring: (const size_t i, const size_t j, const size_t a, const size_t b, const SquareMatrix< Scalar > &f, const SquareRankFourTensor< Scalar > &V_A, const T1Amplitudes< Scalar > &t1, const T2Amplitudes< Scalar > &t2, const ImplicitRankFourTensorSlice< Scalar > &tau2, const ImplicitMatrixSlice< Scalar > &F1, const ImplicitMatrixSlice< Scalar > &F2, const ImplicitMatrixSlice< Scalar > &F3, const ImplicitRankFourTensorSlice< Scalar > &W1, const ImplicitRankFourTensorSlice< Scalar > &W2, const ImplicitRankFourTensorSlice< Scalar > &W3)
memberdef.name: calculateT2AmplitudeEquation

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the value for one of the CCSD T2-amplitude equations, evaluated at the given T1- and T2-amplitudes (and itermediates). f_{ij}^{ab} = <Phi_{ij}^{ab}| H |Phi_0> with H the similarity-transformed normal-ordered Hamiltonian

parameterdescription.para: the (occupied) subscript for the amplitude equation
the other (occupied) subscript for the amplitude equation
the (virtual) superscript for the amplitude equation
the other (virtual) superscript for the amplitude equation
the antisymmetrized two-electron integrals (in physicist's notation)

simplesect.para: the value for one of the CCSD T2-amplitude equations

memberdef.argsstring: (const SquareMatrix< Scalar > &f, const SquareRankFourTensor< Scalar > &V_A, const T1Amplitudes< Scalar > &t1, const ImplicitRankFourTensorSlice< Scalar > &tau2_tilde)
memberdef.name: calculateF1

parameterdescription.para: the antisymmetrized two-electron integrals (in physicist's notation)

simplesect.para: This is one of the intermediate quantities in the factorization of CCSD. In particular, F1 represents equation (3) in Stanton1991.

memberdef.argsstring: (const SquareMatrix< Scalar > &f, const SquareRankFourTensor< Scalar > &V_A, const T1Amplitudes< Scalar > &t1, const ImplicitRankFourTensorSlice< Scalar > &tau2_tilde)

simplesect.para: This is one of the intermediate quantities in the factorization of CCSD. In particular, F3 represents equation (5) in Stanton1991.
This is one of the intermediate quantities in the factorization of CCSD. In particular, tau2 represents equation (10) in Stanton1991.
This is one of the intermediate quantities in the factorization of CCSD. In particular, tau2_tilde represents equation (9) in Stanton1991.
